briefTitle: PeriOcular and INTravitreal Corticosteroids for Uveitic Macular Edema Trial

interventions.name: Intravitreal triamcinolone 4 mg
otherNames: Triescence (in U.S); Kenalog allowed at non-U.S. clinics

outcomeMeasures.title: Proportion of Baseline Central Subfield Thickness Observed at 8 Weeks
outcomeMeasures.description:
The primary outcome is the change in central subfield thickness from baseline to 8 weeks measured on a relative scale as the the proportion of the baseline central subfield thickness. Values less than 1 indicate a decrease in retinal thickness with lower values indicating greater decreases. Smaller values are better.

The time point of 8 weeks was chosen for assessment of the primary outcome because it encompasses the window for maximum benefit for all three treatment strategies. Retinal thickness was evaluated using masked assessments of OCT images.

outcomeMeasures.title: Proportion of Baseline Central Subfield Thickness Observed at 24 Weeks
outcomeMeasures.description: The primary outcome is the change in central subfield thickness from baseline to 24 weeks measured on a relative scale as the the proportion of the baseline central subfield thickness. Values less than 1 indicate a decrease in retinal thickness with lower values indicating greater decreases. Smaller values are better.The time point of 24 weeks was chosen to evaluate the duration of response and the need for additional injections.Retinal thickness was evaluated using masked assessments of OCT images.

outcomeMeasures.title: Proportion of Eyes With >= 20% Reduction in Macular Thickness (or Normalization Even if <20% Reduction) at 8 Weeks
outcomeMeasures.description: Proportion of eyes with \>=20% reduction in macular thickness (or normalization of macular thickness even if there is \<20% reduction) at 8 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: Proportion of Eyes With >= 20% Reduction in Macular Thickness (or Normalization Even if <20% Reduction) at 24 Weeks
outcomeMeasures.description: Proportion of eyes with \>=20% reduction in macular thickness (or normalization of macular thickness even if there is \<20% reduction) at 24 weeks

outcomeMeasures.title: Proportion of Eyes With Resolution of Macular Edema at 8 Weeks
outcomeMeasures.description: Proportion of eyes with resolution of macular edema defined as normalization of the macular thickness (i.e., \< 260 um on the standardized scale) at 8 weeks. The greater the proportion the more eyes achieved resolution of macular edema.

outcomeMeasures.title: Proportion of Eyes With Resolution of Macular Edema at 24 Weeks
outcomeMeasures.description: Proportion of eyes with resolution of macular edema defined as normalization of the macular thickness (i.e., \<260 um on the standard scale) at 24 weeks.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Best-corrected Visual Acuity at 8 Weeks
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean change in best-corrected visual acuity from baseline to 8 weeks. Participants' visual acuity was measured by certified examiners with best refractive correction in place.Participants were challenged with reading letters on lines of the standard ETDRS eye chart (5 letters per line). Lines became smaller as participants progressed from the top to the bottom of the chart. Participants read down the chart until no more meaningful readings could be made and were scored by how many letters could be correctly identified. More letters read is associated with higher visual acuity.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Best-corrected Visual Acuity at 24 Weeks
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean change in best-corrected visual acuity from baseline to 24 weeks. Participants' visual acuity was measured by certified examiners with best refractive correction in place.Participants were challenged with reading letters on lines of the standard ETDRS eye chart (5 letters per line). Lines became smaller as participants progressed from the top to the bottom of the chart. Participants read down the chart until no more meaningful readings could be made and were scored by how many letters could be correctly identified. More letters read is associated with higher visual acuity.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Eyes With Vitreous Hemorrhage
outcomeMeasures.description: Count of eyes with vitreous hemorrhage as an immediate complication of injection.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Eyes With Retinal Tear or Detachment
outcomeMeasures.description: Count of eyes with retinal tears or detachments during the course of follow-up.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Eyes With Endophthalmitis
outcomeMeasures.description: Count of eyes with an occurrence of endophthalmitis

outcomeMeasures.title: Cumulative Proportion of Eyes With Severe Vision Loss
outcomeMeasures.description: Cumulative proportion of eyes with uveitic macular edema who experience severe vision loss (\>= 15 standard letters) during the 24 weeks of follow-up.

outcomeMeasures.title: Cumulative Proportion of Eyes With an IOP Elevation of >=10 mm Hg Over Baseline
outcomeMeasures.description: Cumulative proportion of eyes with uveitic macular edema that experience an IOP elevation of \>=10 mm Hg higher than the baseline level during 24 weeks of follow-up.

outcomeMeasures.title: Cumulative Proportion of Eyes With an IOP Elevation >=24 mm Hg
outcomeMeasures.description: Cumulative proportion of eyes with uveitic macular edema that experience elevated IOP to \>=24 mm Hg during 24 weeks of follow-up.

outcomeMeasures.title: Cumulative Proportion of Eyes With an IOP Elevation >=30 mm Hg
outcomeMeasures.description: Cumulative proportion of eyes with uveitic macular edema that experience elevated IOP to \>=30 mm Hg during 24 weeks of follow-up.
